name: 華國媛
objective:
Nanomaterials are materials with a single unit small sized between 1 and 100 nm.  They have unique optical, electronic, thermo-physical or mechanical properties. Since some nanomaterials have properties of enzyme-like characteristics, they can act as artificial enzyme, which can be used for many applications such as biosensing, bioimaging, tumor diagnosis and so on.  
Students are expected to learn the different types of nanomaterials, unique properties of nanomaterials, the synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials. This class is for upper level undergraduate students, with interested on material science and nanotechnology.

1  Introduction on nanomarterials
2. Different types of nanomaterials - OD, 1D, 2D and 3D
3. Core-shell nanoparticles and gold nanoshells
4. Carbon nanoworld - fullerenes, graphenes and carbon nanotubes
5. Synthesis of nanomaterials- General Instroduction
6. Synthesis of nanomaterials- Top-down Approach
7. Synthesis of nanomaterials- Bottom-up Approach
8.  Advanced synthesis of ALD
9.    Midterm Exam
10. Quantumn mechanics on electros in chemical element 
11. Quantumn mechanics on chemical reactions
12. Quantumn mechanics on photons
13. Materials analysis- SEM and TEM
14. Materials analysis- Element studies and FTIR 
15. Materials analysis- XRD and crystal structure
16. Materials analysis- UV, Raman, XPS and energy levels
17. Applications- ultra-sensitive sensors and aritificial catalysts for sustainable enrionments
18. Fianl exam
